verses.verse: My son,<WH1121> keep<WH8104> my words,<WH561> And treasure<WH6845> my commandments<WH4687> within<WH854> you.
Keep<WH8104> my commandments<WH4687> and live,<WH2421> And my teaching<WH8451> as the apple<WH380> of your eye.<WH5869>
Bind<WH7194> them on your fingers;<WH676> Write<WH3789> them on the tablet<WH3871> of your heart.<WH3820>
Say<WH559> to wisdom,<WH2451> "You are my sister,<WH269>" And call<WH7121> understanding<WH998> [your] intimate<WH4129> friend;<WH4129>
That they may keep<WH8104> you from an adulteress,<WH802> <WH2114> From the foreigner<WH5237> who flatters<WH9140> with her words.<WH561>
For at the window<WH2474> of my house<WH1004> I looked<WH8259> out through<WH1157> my lattice,<WH822>
And I saw<WH7200> among the naive,<WH6612> I discerned<WH995> among the youths,<WH1121> A young<WH5288> man<WH5288> lacking<WH2638> sense,<WH3820>
Passing<WH5674> through the street<WH7784> near<WH681> her corner;<WH6438> And he takes<WH6805> the way<WH1870> to her house,<WH1004>
In the twilight,<WH5399> in the evening,<WH6153> <WH3117> In the middle<WH380> of the night<WH3915> and [in] the darkness.<WH653>
And behold,<WH2009> a woman<WH802> [comes] to meet<WH7122> him, Dressed<WH7897> as a harlot<WH2181> and cunning<WH5341> of heart.<WH3820>
She is boisterous<WH1993> and rebellious;<WH5637> Her feet<WH7272> do not remain<WH7931> at home;<WH1004>
[She is] now<WH6471> in the streets,<WH2351> now<WH6471> in the squares,<WH7339> And lurks<WH693> by every<WH3605> corner.<WH6438>
So she seizes<WH2388> him and kisses<WH5401> him, And with a brazen<WH5810> face<WH6440> she says<WH559> to him:
"I was due<WH5921> to offer<WH2077> peace<WH8002> offerings;<WH8002> Today<WH3117> I have paid<WH9608> my vows.<WH5088>
"Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> I have come<WH3318> out to meet<WH7122> you, To seek<WH7836> your presence<WH6440> earnestly,<WH7836> and I have found<WH4672> you.
"I have spread<WH7234> my couch<WH6210> with coverings,<WH4765> With colored<WH2405> linens<WH330> of Egypt.<WH4714>
"I have sprinkled<WH5130> my bed<WH4904> With myrrh,<WH4753> aloes<WH174> and cinnamon.<WH7076>
"Come,<WH1980> let us drink<WH7301> our fill<WH7301> of love<WH1730> until<WH5704> morning;<WH1242> Let us delight<WH5965> ourselves with caresses.<WH159>
"For the man<WH376> is not at home,<WH1004> He has gone<WH1980> on a long<WH7350> <WH4970> journey;<WH1870>
He has taken<WH3947> a bag<WH6872> of money<WH3701> with him, At full<WH3677> moon<WH3677> he will come<WH935> home.<WH1004> "
With her many<WH7230> persuasions<WH3948> she entices<WH5186> him; With her flattering<WH9141> lips<WH8193> she seduces<WH5080> him.
Suddenly<WH6597> he follows<WH1980> <WH310> her, As an ox<WH7794> goes<WH935> to the slaughter,<WH2874> Or as [one in] fetters<WH5914> to the discipline<WH4148> of a fool,<WH191>

Until<WH5704> an arrow<WH2671> pierces<WH6398> through<WH6398> his liver;<WH3516> As a bird<WH6833> hastens<WH4116> to the snare,<WH6341> So he does not know<WH3045> that it [will cost him] his life.<WH5315>
Now<WH6258> therefore, [my] sons,<WH1121> listen<WH8085> to me, And pay<WH7181> attention<WH7181> to the words<WH561> of my mouth.<WH6310>
Do not let your heart<WH3820> turn<WH7847> aside<WH7847> to her ways,<WH1870> Do not stray<WH8582> into her paths.<WH9350>
For many<WH7227> are the victims<WH2491> she has cast<WH5307> down,<WH5307> And numerous<WH6099> are all<WH3605> her slain.<WH2026>
Her house<WH1004> is the way<WH1870> to Sheol,<WH7585> Descending<WH3381> to the chambers<WH2315> of death.<WH4194>
